text.0: to him who shines afar vaiśvānara shall bards give precious things that he may go on certain paths.
text.1: for agni the immortal serves the deities and therefore never breaks their everlasting laws.
text.2: he wondrous envoy goes between the earth and heaven firm seated as the herald great high priest of men.
text.3: he compassethwith rays the lofty dwellingplace agni sent forward by the gods enriched with piayer.
text.4: sages shall glorify agni with earnest thoughts ensign of sacrifice who fills the synod full.
text.5: in whom the singers have stored up their holy acts to him the worshipper looks for joy and happiness.
text.6: the sire of sacrifice great god of holy bards agni the measure and the symbol of the priests.
text.7: hath entered heaven and earth that show in varied form the sage whom many love rejoiceth in his might.
text.8: bright agni with the bright car lord of green domains vaiśvānara dweller in the floods who finds the light.
text.9: pervading swift and wild encompassed round with powers him very glorious have the gods established here.
text.10: agni together with the gods and manus folk by thought extending sacrifice in varied form.
text.11: goes carborne to and fro with those who crown each rite the fleet the household friend who turns the curse aside.
text.12: sing agni for long life to us and noble sons teem thou with plenty shine upon us store of food.
text.13: increase the great mans strength thou evervigilant thou longing for the gods knowest their hymns full well.
text.14: the mighty one lord of the people and their guest the leader of their thoughts devoted friend of priests.
text.15: our solemn rites announcer jātavedas men with worship ever praise with urgings for their weal.
text.16: agni the god resplendent giver of great joy hath on his lovely car compassed the lands with might.
text.17: let us with pure laudations in his house approach the high laws of the nourisher of multitudes.
text.18: i celebrate thy glories o vaiśvānara wherewith thou o farsighted god has found the light.
text.19: thou filledst at thy birth both worlds the earth and heaven all this o agni hast thou compassed of thyself.
text.20: by his great skill the sage alone hath brought to pass a great deed mightier than vaiśvānaras wondrous acts.
text.21: agni sprang into being magnifying both his parents heaven and earth rich in prolific seed.
